abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column recommends Rabbi Jonathan Sacks book Not in God's Name: Confronting Religious Violence, saying it explains how rise of Islamic State is linked to larger global trend toward desecularization and religious conflicts; notes Sacks suggests that military might will be insufficient to combat groups like Islamic State, and that effective opposition to similar groups will come from offering up alternative religious views.
lead_paragraph: The answer to ending religious violence will probably be found within religion itself.

headline.main: Finding Peace Within the Holy Texts
